intro: Astragalus vesicarius subsp. carniolicus, commonly known as the Carpathian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has compound leaves with small leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological adaptations.
